Params: Wise is standing in the lab at the usual stop, opening the metal box he hasn't touched for years.
A sextant lies silently inside a foam beside a card covered in various handwriting.
He picks up the card and silently reads every word that he has already memorized by heart.
Wise, stay safe. We'll be back before you know it.
Wise, my little buddy. Don't be sad. I know it's not fair for Professor Kalon to choose the members for the experiment before you finish your thesis.
But you're young and shouldn't be in anything this dangerous. You've never had a girlfriend, right? I'll introduce you to a lady when I get back!
Wise, sorry to leave you behind but I'm sure Professor has good reasons. Take care of yourself.
I left you a bottle of stomach medication in the cupboard. I know you've been having stomach problems. Remember to take them on time.
Wise, best of luck on your thesis! Treat us to something nice when we get back, alright?
Hey, bud. I won't write anything. I'll tell you everything over beer next time!
Dear Wise, good luck on your final stretch. I'm not good with words so I'll leave it at that. We love you.
Wise, buddy! From now on you'll be representing Team Kalon! Don't let us down!
I have a video of Bill getting revenge for you when that douche from the other lab made fun of you.
I've sent it to your mail. It'll give you a good laugh.
Wise, my good buddy. Best wishes for your future! By the way, mind if it takes me just a little longer to give you back the money you spotted me?
Wise reads the letters silently many times before putting them carefully into his chest pocket.
Then, he makes an unusual decision after pondering for a long time.
He silently takes out an empty card and adds a few lines—
I don't know if you would ever read this. I wasn't planning on giving you the things Professor left for me.
But if someday you come to possess it, please take good care of it.
At that point, you would have already known my relationship with Professor Kalon.
Perhaps I have never understood the reason he gave me this sextant.
I've often used it to stare at the moon, the place where I'll never be able to go.
I was never an outstanding student. All of my seniors were much better than me.
That is why I was the only one left behind.
That is my greatest regret in life, something I will never be able to make up for.
I never managed to come to terms with my past, and I've been living in it. I know I'll never be the next Kalon. His capabilities are way beyond me.
But you're different. You have proven yourself, and your world reaches far beyond mine.
I've always taught you to keep your heart to yourself, but that's the trait of a coward.
I can no longer change. I am a coward and must walk the path of one.
But I have faith that if you are reading this letter one day, that means you have become much stronger.
...Strong enough to find your place in a world much bigger than I can imagine.
I can't believe a guy like him can write such a sentimental letter like this.
Reading this now brings up many different emotions.
Karenina finally learns the truth of what happened to her grandpa after the incident at the lunar base.
She doesn't want to think of that experiment as a tragedy. She will remember it as mortals bravely fighting for their future.
Grandpa probably didn't take Wise on the mission only because he knew that the journey might be a one-way trip.
Grandpa didn't want his youngest student to die at such a young age.
Wise's seniors must have known that, too, so they left him behind and headed into danger themselves.
And Wise never wrapped his head around that...?
No, I think he did. He just couldn't bring himself to swallow the truth.
It's a stubbornness that belongs only to technicians... to scientists, and that's the only thing I understand about him.
He thought he didn't have a choice, but he actually made his choice long ago.
But there's no use dwelling on his choices now—all of that is in the past.
I stopped worrying long ago... Wait, that's not exactly right.
What are you going to do with this sextant? Are you going to keep it?
Karenina thinks for a moment with her eyes closed.
Karenina walks to the window of the bridge and turns off the screen so she can look into the universe.
In the boundless and deep universe, the sun is burning brightly and silently in the middle of the solar system, its rays lighting up Karenina's face from one side.
Everything in this world needs another object to refer to in order to know its own place.
Earth only knows its place in the universe because of the sun, and the moon knows its place because of Earth.
Even objects that are lightyears away are connected this way.
Maybe Grandpa gave this sextant to Wise to tell him that this tiny device would connect them even if he was the only one left on Earth, even if they were 380 thousand kilometers apart.
That they would keep him on course and shield him from storms so he could move forward straight and true.
And deep down, there is this "pulling force" in all of it.
Karenina keeps her head low for a moment while looking at the sextant before she finally moves her gaze to focus on Bianca.
But if that's the case, then I won't need this anymore.
I've got you, Teddy, and everyone at Engineering Force.
I guess you could count Lucia... and that particular commandant...
Because of you, I've found my place and won't ever be lost again.
I can finally see who I am because of all of you.
I'll give this sextant to the Education Center or WGAA.
Kids nowadays have probably never seen anything like this. I'm sure lots of people would want this in their collection because it's handmade by Grandpa.
So do me a favor and give this to Ayla, will you? She knows what to do with it better than I do.
Karenina, the calculation is done. It's time for work!
In comes Teddy through the door.
Oh? A guest? Are you also here to save Karenina?
No, no, no. It's Karenina who saved me many times.
What does that mean? Of course! How do you think I became Captain, Miss Vice-Captain?
Oh? Then I'm sure you can handle everything on your own. I'll get everyone to leave...
Wait, wait, wait! I was just joking! Don't be so serious.
Karenina quickly grabs Teddy's sleeves and starts heading toward the door with her.
Come on, let's get it over with and show CC what we are made of.
Don't forget to treat everyone after the mission.
I will! Bianca, come join us. It's my treat.
They wave goodbye at each other in the hallway. Bianca takes a quick glance at Karenina and Teddy as they walk away side by side, and turns to leave in the opposite direction.
She wonders how she's ended up with all these people in her life...
And how her world has gotten so much bigger because of them.
Seems like we're just going to get busier down the road.
Slowly but surely, she's moving down the path she has chosen.
